attributes.title: Beartooth Mountain Springs Bottled Water
attributes.description:
Created on November 16, 2010 by VictoriaEdwards on Sourcemap.org:

Beartooth Mountain Springs water out of Clark, WY bottles spring water at the base of the source in the Beartooth Mountains.  Considered a high end bottled water, it is then shipped from the bottling plant to natural food stores, spas, and restaurants throughout the West.

attributes.name: Beartooth Mountain Springs Bottled Water
attributes.title: Beartooth Mountain Springs Bottled Water
attributes.description: Beartooth Mountain Springs water out of Clark, WY bottles spring water at the base of the source in the Beartooth Mountains.  Considered a high end bottled water, it is then shipped from the bottling plant to natural food stores, spas, and restaurants throughout the West.

attributes.name: Glass Bottle
attributes.title: Glass Bottle
attributes.description: The 750mL glass bottles used for the water come from a company in Dallas, TX.

attributes.name: Spring Water
attributes.title: Spring Water
attributes.description: Spring water flows naturally 280 feet down from the spring and through a metal pipe, to the Beartooth Mountain Springs bottling facility.  The water is bottled, and then shipped from the bottling plant.  A minimum order consists of one pallet, or 720 bottles, which is equivalent to over 18,000 ounces of water.  Customers can purchase up to 20 pallets, or 14,400 bottles, equal to almost 400,000 ounces of water.
